title: Google Service SUCKS - Water Damage to Pixel 2 XL
content:
Problems:
• USB-C port malfunctioning (since few weeks ago)
• Water damage from a momentary fall into 1m pool (yesterday)
* Now I can't ask google to call since my country (Sri Lanka) is not listed. And I cant find an email through which I can contact them.
--------------
My friend bought a Pixel 2 XL from Google in May 2018. He returned it and got a replacement since it was charging slowly. I bought that replacement phone from him in August 2018. I changed the ownership to my account and verified that this phone has international warranty from a Google agent. (I have screenshots).

Within few weeks, the phone fell down and the camera was broken. I contacted Google, they connected me to CTDI, the google-authorized repair agents. They charged me $400 to replace the camera. They promised the waterproofing would be intact after the costly repair (I have screenshots).

Then I moved to my home country: Sri Lanka in December 2018. Within weeks, the USB-C port started malfunctioning. I raised the issue and Google promised to send a charger through my friend (which I have yet to receive).

Now (March 2019), I accidentally dropped my phone in the shallow end of the swimming pool (about 1m depth). I immediately recovered the phone. It worked for 30 minutes and then it shut down. I thoroughly let it dry in air and tried again. Now the phone shuts down immediately after I switch on. Even then, the screen has a permanent pink line when switched on.

-----------------

The phone is supposed to be IP67 (30 minutes at 1m depth), but it is not. I believe the AUTHORIZED agents who repaired the camera have screwed up the CERTIFIED water resistance AGAINST THEIR PROMISE.

Since I have the INTERNATIONAL WARRANTY, kind help me to repair the phone. Please contact via email for more details.

I am willing to pay for the postage to send the phone overseas for repair. I just want google to listen to me and find a way to help me here.
